Trevor Harmon wrote:
> 
> 
> I'm testing a complicated data structure, and I've written a method
> that prints the structure to the console for debugging purposes. I'd
> like to have this method run automatically if and only if a test
> fails. For instance, I'd like to write something like this:
> 
> @After
> public void tearDown()
> {
> if (testFailed())
> printDiagnostics();
> }
> 
> Is there some way of doing that? Thanks,

This is typically what failure messages are for, so that the assertion 
can tell us why it failed. Given the little I can tell about your case, 
I would use it like this:

     assertTrue(dump(myDataStructure), isCorrect(myDataStructure));

If your data structure's toString() method prints out this diagnostic 
information, then you get the diagnostics free when you compare your 
data structure to the expected values with assertEquals(). For that, of 
course, you'd also need to implement equals() on your data structure.

I hope this helps.
